item.title: Bitcoin Block Propagation and IBLT
item.description: Bitcoin Block Propagation Iblt Rusty Russell This is not what I do. But I was doing it anyway. The problem is that blocks are transmitted in their entirety. If you have a 1 MB uplink and you’re connecting to 8 peers, your first peer will see a 1MB block in about 66.8 seconds. And the last one will get it in 76.4 seconds, because we basically blast out blocks in parallel to our peers.
